remarks.format: ## Remarks 受保护的成员专门用于仅由.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构在内部使用的派生类。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. 在初始化过程，.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构动态生成并编译派生自的反序列化的临时类。During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization that is derived from . 在此过程中，该基础结构生成方法并创建对象来存储修补方法和其输入的数据。During this process, the infrastructure generates methods and it creates objects to store the fix-up methods and their input data. 基础结构未因此针对 SOAP 编码数组或其数据类型，在任一情况下，SOAP 编码的多引用的元素将映射到.NET Framework 集合或枚举。The infrastructure does so for SOAP-encoded arrays or SOAP-encoded, multi-referenced elements whose data types, in either case, map to .NET Framework collections or enumerations. 接下来，根据需要，在反序列化来填充数组项或多个引用对象过程中调用方法。Next, as necessary, the methods are invoked during deserialization to fill in array items or multi-referenced objects. 不应直接创建的实例或类。You should not directly create an instance of the or class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 受保护的成员专门用于仅由.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构在内部使用的派生类。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. .NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构动态创建的修正方法的实现的实例时为.NET Framework 对象，反序列化 XML 文档，委托和创建实例类若要修复向上方法和其输入的数据存储中。While deserializing XML documents into .NET Framework objects, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically creates instances of fix-up methods that implement the delegate and creates instances of the class to store the fix-up methods and their input data. 基础结构未因此 SOAP 编码的数组，其数据类型映射到.NET Framework 引用类型。The infrastructure does so for SOAP-encoded arrays whose data types map to .NET Framework reference types. 接下来，根据需要修复向上方法调用来填充数组中的对象。Next, as necessary, a fix-up method is called to fill in the objects in the array. 此外，在初始化过程，.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构动态生成并编译派生自的反序列化的临时类。In addition, during initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization that derives from . 在此过程中，该基础结构生成方法和SOAP 编码的多引用 XML 数据的对象。During this process, the infrastructure generates methods and objects for SOAP-encoded, multi-referenced XML data. 在反序列化过程中，然后调用这些方法。The methods are then invoked during deserialization. 不应直接创建的实例或类。You should not directly create instances of the or classes.

SOAP 编码允许唯一的 XML 元素作为 SOAP 消息中出现一次`multiRef`标识元素`id`属性。SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute. `id`值可由引用多次`ref`属性 (或`href`SOAP 1.1 中的属性) 替换元素中。The `id` value can be referenced multiple times by `ref` attributes (or `href` attributes in SOAP 1.1) in substitute elements. SOAP 1.1 规范第 5 节中介绍了 SOAP 编码。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 受保护的成员专门用于仅由.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构在内部使用的派生类。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. SOAP 编码允许唯一的 XML 元素作为 SOAP 消息中出现一次`multiRef`标识元素`id`属性。SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute. `id`值可以是引用的多次使用`href`属性 (或`ref`SOAP 1.2 中的属性) 替换元素中。The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements. SOAP 1.1 规范第 5 节中介绍了 SOAP 编码。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 受保护的成员专门用于仅由.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构在内部使用的派生类。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. SOAP 编码，作为中指定的 SOAP 1.1 规范中，第 5 部分允许多次引用 SOAP 消息中的元素 (或 （可选），只需一次) 以引用的`href`中的主消息属性。SOAP encoding, as specified in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification, allows for elements referenced multiple times in a SOAP message (or optionally, just once) to be referred by an `href` attribute in the main message. 事件发生时将出现此类元素，但没有任何`href`到它的引用。An event occurs when such an element appears, but there is no `href` reference to it. 添加到处理程序方法提供的未引用的对象，而自定义处理执行其方法。Add a handler method to to provide custom handling for unreferenced objects while the executes its method.
